comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: A fine family group. I suspect that the man on the right is a naval Petty Officer and not a civilian.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content:
The sailor on the left has a badge on his right arm that looks like it could be a Royal Navy physical trainer badge 2nd class which was a pair of crossed clubs with a star above and a star below.
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/39191857@N05] I think you are right about the officer on the right not being a civilian. Its difficult to see exactly whats on his collar badge but it looks like two crossed guns with a star above which would indicate a gunlayer, if they are crossed torpedos that would indicate a leading torpedo man.
I believe the stripes on the right sleeves of both mens uniforms indicate overseas service, one stripe for each 12 months.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Damn! So am I completely wrong about the White Star Line? I just vaguely remember something identified ages ago by RETRO STU as White Star, but more than willing to sit corrected...

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: I am puzzled by a minor point in this pic. Both the Naval Rating and Petty Officer appear to be wearing their Long Service/Good Conduct stripes on their right arm sleeves. The correct way is for the stripes to be worn on the left arm. I wonder if this pic have been inverted? 3 stripes indicate a minimum of 13 years long service with good conduct. 2 stripes denoting at least 7 years similar service and one stripe for at least 5 years. The rating is wearing a GUNLAYER 1st CLASS badge and the Chief Petty Officer has a LEADING TORPEDOMAN badge on the front of his collar lapels.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
Hi Carol.
Can you do me a favour please and have a closer look at the badge on the Naval Rating's sleeve. Can you tell if it's a crown or star in the upper quadrant of the badge?
Thanks.
Stuart.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/23885771@N03/] On the full size image the ratings badge looks more like a physical trainer 2nd class badge with 2 crossed clubs and a star above and below  (could be wrong of course)

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] Thanks. I thought it's a Gunlayer's badge looking like two crossed cannons. The clubs have a more rounded and bulbous heads to them.
